description: '''Spiritual jazz''' is a sub-genre of [[jazz]] that originated in the United States during the 1960s. The genre is hard to characterize musically but draws from [[Free jazz|free]], [[Avant-garde jazz|avant-garde]] and [[modal jazz]] and thematically focuses on [[Transcendence (religion)|transcendence]] and [[spirituality]]. [[John Coltrane]]'s 1965 album ''[[A Love Supreme]]'' is considered a landmark in the genre.
